full_threads.body:
Thank you.



Just to let you know, I'll be sending you the new header and other graphics to update on the website on Monday morning now, so it would be great if you could upload during your day on Tuesday. Can I check that the header on the home page needs to be 1366x500px?



Hope you both have great weekends!



Victoria




Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/

Hi Victoria, 

Ok sure, the arabic translation is now updated. 

And yes we will do our best and should be able to accommodate the upload of the new graphics.
@heath All done on the Arabic translation.

Thanks Heath. We've got an urgent change that needs making to one line of text on the Arabic version of the home page. Would it be possible to make this change as soon as possible?



It's the translation for 'My Invisible MS' in Arabic has changed and so the text circled in yellow below needs to be replaced with:

الوجه الخفي للتصلب المتعدد







Regarding the other updates, if I send the new graphics to you by end of Friday UK time, would it possible to have it updated during the day (your time) on Monday?



Many thanks,
Victoria




Victoria Gilbert

Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)

+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 | victoria@msif.org | http://www.msif.org/

Hi Victoria, 

Ok great, the changes will probably only take 2 - 3 hours, depending on their complexity. 

Regarding the date showing up, we too have done everything we can to get this removed. I'm not sure what else there can be done besides contacting Google. Perhaps a specialised SEO agency would be able to help, do you have one?

Hi Joel and Heath,


The colour scheme for our World MS Day graphics are going to change slightly, meaning that the following will need to be updated with the new colouring once ready:

· MyInvisibleMS header on the homepage

· The three events, news and tools boxes on home page

· Latest news background box

· Symptom graphic on About page


I'm just trying to plan timings, so would be great if you could you let me know (by the end of 5th Dec Sydney time) how much time you'll need to make these changes across the languages? We should have the new colours ready within the next week and a half.


On a separate note, when you google World MS Day, it still brings up the wrong date (29 May rather than 30 May). We have tried to add the correct date where possible on the site, but it's still not sorted. Are you able to help with this?


Thanks,

Victoria

Hi Victoria,

Sure, we have updated the worldmsday links for all the languages.
https://worldmsday.org/

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath and Joel,

I hope you’re both well.

I’ve noticed that the link is broken on the three orange boxes (events, tools and news) on the home page. Could these be fixed please?

Many thanks,
Victoria

Victoria Gilbert
Head of International Communications and Campaigns, Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)
+44 (0) 20 7620 1911 <tel:+44%2020%207620%201911> | victoria@msif.org <mailto:victoria@msif.org> | www.msif.org <http://www.msif.org/>

From: Natasha Smith
Sent: 31 October 2018 10:14
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au>; Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org>
Subject: RE: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update

Hi Heath,

Thanks so much. Today is my last day with MSIF, so I’ll now hand over to Victoria, our Head of International Campaigns and Communications, until the new Campaign and Content Manager starts.

Thanks for everything! All the best for the future.

Best wishes,
Natasha

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ [mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>]
Sent: 31 October 2018 06:16
To: Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:joel@wolfiq.com.au>>; Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org <mailto:victoria@msif.org>>
Subject: Re: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update
Importance: High

Hi Natasha,

Ok sure, confirming we have made the below updates now.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

<https://wolfiq.com.au/>


On 30 Oct 2018, at 8:57 pm, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Thanks for this. Happy with the visuals but the ‘News’, ‘Events’ and ‘Tools’ boxes are now only displaying with English text in every language version of the page – i.e. the French, Spanish, Arabic and Portuguese pages all contain the English text. We obviously need this to be changed asap.

Also, I’d prefer the ‘My Invisible MS’ and ‘What’s the idea’ text to be placed above the three boxes, so people can immediately see the campaign summary without having to scroll down.

Hopefully you can make these changes asap. Thanks very much.

Best wishes,
Natasha

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ [mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>]
Sent: 30 October 2018 01:38
To: Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:joel@wolfiq.com.au>>; Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org <mailto:victoria@msif.org>>
Subject: Re: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update

Hi Natasha,

Confirming we have updated the images on the site.

With the home page, the slider looked a little flat with the images we had to work with. The main All Symptoms image composition works well at the top (by itself) so we created three boxes underneath to hold the key ‘call to actions’. I think this is a actually a better result as there is a heap of research available now that says sliders have lost their effectiveness and nothing ‘important’ should be placed in them. Have a look and let me know your thoughts? I think it’s a great, subtle evolution.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
<https://wolfiq.com.au/>


On 29 Oct 2018, at 9:21 pm, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Thanks, I appreciate it. I had to remove the square brackets from around ‘My Invisible MS’ on the homepage, but that’s not a big issue.

Look forward to having all the updates ready for first thing tomorrow morning (my time) so I can go ahead and announce the campaign.

Best wishes,
Natasha

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ [mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>]
Sent: 29 October 2018 08:57
To: Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:joel@wolfiq.com.au>>; Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org <mailto:victoria@msif.org>>
Subject: Re: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update

Hi Natasha,

Ok thanks for the extra direction.

I can confirm the language/copy updates have been completed on the home page.

Regarding the images, we have you scheduled in for first thing tomorrow morning (Sydney time). This will mean that they will be upload by approximately midnight your time on 29 October. I understand your deadline and we are doing everything we possibly can to squeeze this in.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
<https://wolfiq.com.au/>



On 26 Oct 2018, at 7:15 pm, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Regarding the images:
· Homepage slider images: all of these need to be updated with a selection of the images I’ve sent you. So, you could use one of the ‘all symptoms’ images, one of the #MyInvisibleMS hashtag images, one of the headers, and a selection of the individual symptoms (pain, balance, dizziness etc.) too. There are different colour options for the individual symptoms – happy for you to try the orange and/or blue background versions to see what looks best.
· Rest of homepage: please insert one or two of the symptom images/one of the headers/all symptom images below the slider images – again, whichever looks best in the space available
· Other pages: Insert the #MyInvisibleMS hashtag wherever the #bringinguscloser was previously across the site. It was previously positioned at the top/middle/bottom of different pages, e.g. the About page, News page and Events page
· Tools page: could replace the header with one of the 1366x500 images – either all symptoms or one of the headers
· If there are opportunities to add images to other gaps/areas across the site, feel free to experiment with this

Essentially, I’d like you to pepper the above images in these different locations on the different pages, using your experience to identify where they fit best. Later on, we’ll have the PosterMaker page and Take Part page public again, so at that point we can add a couple more of the images (we may have some new ones by then too). This is just a starting point so the site has an updated visual identity for me to publicly announce the 2019 campaign.

Would be great if you can get these updates completed by Monday 29th Oct; as I mentioned, I’m moving on from MSIF on Wednesday 31st Oct and it’s essential that I announce the campaign before then.

Thanks very much.

Best wishes,
Natasha

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: 26 October 2018 07:00
To: Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:joel@wolfiq.com.au>>; Victoria Gilbert <victoria@msif.org <mailto:victoria@msif.org>>
Subject: Re: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update

Hi Natasha,

I can confirm the copy updates will be done this afternoon. Regarding the images, can you please be more specific with which ones you want to appear throughout the site.

It’s a complex site to update, so I’m trying minimise back-and-forth. Apologies for only raising this now, I assumed there was some order to them in the YouSendIt files.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
<https://wolfiq.com.au/>




On 23 Oct 2018, at 7:46 pm, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Thanks for getting back to me. I’d really appreciate it if you could speed up the process – I’m actually going to be moving on from MSIF at the end of October and it’s crucial I make the announcement as soon as possible. Please could you aim to get all this done by this Friday at the latest? It really is quite urgent.

In terms of the plan once I’ve left, Victoria (cc’d) will be your main point of contact until my successor begins (hopefully around Dec/Jan time).

Thanks very much.

Best wishes,
Natasha

From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: 23 October 2018 09:00
To: Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>>
Cc: Joel Maligalig <joel@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:joel@wolfiq.com.au>>
Subject: Re: WMSD 2019 Website Visuals - update

Hi Natasha,

Thanks for this, we will review and aim to have them up by this time next week.

Speak soon,

Heath Maguire
Creative Director - Wolf IQ

P. 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | M. 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
www.wolfiq.com.au <http://www.wolfiq.com.au/>

On 23 Oct 2018, at 12:02 am, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Just sent you via WeTransfer a selection of 2019 campaign visuals to update the World MS Day website along with updated website copy.

Images:
I’d like you to pepper these visuals across the site, especially in the homepage slider images. Whilst I can add images into individual website posts, I’d like you to incorporate the visuals across different pages of the site, so that the site looks up to date with no references to bringing us closer and a clear visual identity for the 2019 campaign. (Note – I’ve already removed most of the bringing us closer visual references but this needs tidying up).

I think the white symbols on the orange background work really well. However, for the visuals that contain text, please avoid using the images containing white text on an orange background for now as we suspect this may be unsuitable for people with visual impairments (TBC). So, for images containing text, please use one of the blue variants.

Please remove the connecting lines across the site that were part of the bringing us closer campaign.

Website copy:
There is only a small amount of copy for the homepage and tools page at the moment, but there will be more copy to follow as we get closer to the campaign, i.e. when we make the ‘take part’ and ‘PosterMaker’ pages public.

A little background:
Each of the symbols represents an invisible symptom of MS (e.g. pain, fatigue, balance, etc.). Our designers will use PosterMaker software embedded in a page of the WMSD website that enables users to upload a photo of themselves, choose from a list of invisible MS symptoms, then apply the symbol overlay that’s connected to their symptom on top of their photo. I sent you some early poster designs and the symptom symbols to give you an idea (these are in the ‘Intro’ folder). Users will be able to produce printable posters and shareable social media versions.

I need the website to be updated before I can publicly announce the 2019 campaign, and I need to make that announcement as soon as possible this week. So, please can you get this done as quickly as possible, ideally by Wednesday 24th?

Thanks very much!

Best wishes,
Natasha

Natasha Smith
Campaign & Content Manager
Multiple Sclerosis International Federation (MSIF)
T. +44 (0) 20 7620 1911 <tel:+44%2020%207620%201911>
E. natasha@msif.org <mailto:natasha@msif.org>
W. www.msif.org <http://www.msif.org/>

I will be leaving MSIF at the end of October to begin a new role. My last day with MSIF will be Wednesday 31st October.

<image001.jpg>
MSIF is a charity and company limited by guarantee, registered in England and Wales. Company No: 05088553. Registered Charity No: 1105321 <tel:1105321>.
